DOC.brief_title: Trial Treatment Chronic Laryngitis With Amitryptiline
DOC.detailed_description: The study compare effectiveness amitriptyline versus placebo ( inactive medication ) treat chronic laryngitis . At baseline visit , subject assign random amitriptyline placebo take 8 week . Subjects see clinic baseline 8 week . Improvement measure use standardized symptom scale , self-reported subjective improvement percentage .
DOC.criteria: Age 18 old able consent . Structural pathology tumor previously rule use flexible laryngoscopy . Able speak read English language . Failed trial proton pump inhibitor treatment gastopharyngeal reflux . Women 55 year age may become pregnant must negative pregnancy test agree barrier hormonal method contraception study . Environmental allergy . Smoking within past 5 year . Using ginko bilboa ( unwilling cease use ) . Current upper respiratory infection . Use narcotic ( e.g . oxycodone , methadone ) . Any prior history amitryptiline use . Use monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOIs ) within past 4 week ( selegiline , phenelzine , tranylcypromine , isocarboxazid , rasagiline , phenelzine sulfate , selegiline hydrochloride , rasagiline mesylate , tranylcypromine sulfate ) . History urinary retention . Any history major depressive disorder . Any prior history allergy tricyclic antidepressant . Current diagnosis gastroesophageal reflux ( GERD ) . For woman 1855 year age without history menopause : currently nurse pregnant , plan become pregnant , unwillingness utilize contraception ( barrier hormonal method ) .
